Marketing Manager Job at Nigeria Markt




        
    

        
        Nigeria Markt is an online marketplace where buyers and sellers connect effortlessly. Whether users are selling pre-loved items, discovering amazing deals, or sourcing essential services, our platform makes it simple, secure, and convenient. We empower individuals and businesses with a seamless, user-friendly experience that enables them to list products, reach potential buyers, and close deals—without middlemen or extra fees.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Manager
Job Location: Benin City, Edo (Remote / Hybrid options optional)
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a results-driven Marketing Manager to lead and execute our marketing strategy, grow our user base, and strengthen Nigeria Markt’s brand presence nationwide.
	You will be responsible for creating and managing campaigns that drive platform adoption while building a recognizable and trusted marketplace brand.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute integrated marketing campaigns to increase brand awareness and platform usage.
	Drive user acquisition for buyers and sellers using digital marketing channels including social media, SEO, content marketing, email campaigns, and paid advertising.
	Manage and grow Nigeria Markt’s social media pages with compelling content and community engagement.
	Work closely with product and customer support teams to ensure campaigns align with user needs.
	Track and analyze campaign performance using marketing analytics tools and provide data-driven recommendations.
	Build partnerships with influencers, affiliates, and community promoters to expand audience reach.
	Maintain consistency in brand messaging across all marketing touchpoints.
	Plan promotions, referral programs, and grassroots marketing activities.
	Manage marketing budgets effectively to maximize ROI.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, or a related field is an advantage.
	Proven experience as a Marketing Manager or similar role, ideally within digital platforms, e-commerce, or marketplace environments.
	Strong understanding of digital marketing tools and strategies including SEO, paid ads, content marketing, and social media growth.
	Ability to analyze performance metrics and optimize campaigns using analytics platforms.
	Excellent communication, leadership, and project management skills.
	Creative problem-solver with a data-driven mindset.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary with performance-based bonuses.
	Free fully furnished accommodation provided in Benin City.
	Flexible working arrangements (remote or hybrid options).
	The opportunity to lead marketing operations for a fast-growing Nigerian startup.
	Career development and learning opportunities.
	A supportive, growth-focused team culture.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter highlighting relevant achievements and why they would be a great fit for Nigeria Markt to: nigeriamarkt7@gmail.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.

	We are looking for a Procurement Team Lead to oversee and manage our procurement operation, ensuring the acquisition of goods and services while maintaining strong vendor relationships.

	Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines

Procurement Team Lead Job at Eko Maintenance Limited




        
    

        
        Eko Maintenance Limited is a rapidly growing Facility Management Company that specializes in maintenance of high-rise building facilities with an office located in Victoria Island, Lagos.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Team Lead
Job Location: Lagos,
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a Procurement Team Lead to oversee and manage our procurement operation, ensuring the acquisition of goods and services while maintaining strong vendor relationships.
	The Ideal candidate should be a strategic thinker with excellent leadership skills and deep understanding of Supply chain Management, developing procurement strategies, negotiating contracts and ensure compliance with company policies and industry regulations.


Responsibilities


	Team Leadership: Guide, manage, and mentor the procurement team, fostering a positive and collaborative environment.
	Strategy Development: Develop and implement innovative procurement strategies aligned with company objectives and cost-saving goals.
	Supplier Management: Source, evaluate, and select suppliers, negotiate contracts to secure favourable terms, and maintain strong, long-term vendor relationships.
	Process Management: Oversee the end-to-end procurement process, including requisitions, purchasing, receiving, and invoicing.
	Cost Control: Monitor budgets, analyse procurement expenditures, identify cost-saving opportunities, and track key performance indicators (KPIs).
	Compliance: Ensure all procurement activities comply with company policies, relevant laws, and regulatory requirements.
	Collaboration: Work closely with internal departments to understand their procurement needs and ensure timely delivery of goods and services.
	Performance Improvement: Monitor supplier and team performance, identify areas for process improvement, and implement solutions to enhance efficiency and productivity.
	Reporting: Prepare and present reports on procurement activities, expenditures, and cost savings to management.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s and Masters degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or related field
	5 + years of experience in procurement or supply chain management
	2 + years of experience in a leadership or supervisory role
	Experience in Purchasing construction and mechanical tool is an added advantage.
	Strong negotiation and contract management skills
	Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities
	Proficiency in procurement software and Microsoft Office Suites
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
	Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines
	Knowledge of Procurement regulations and compliance standards
	Experience with supplier relationship management.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidate should send their CV to: recruitment2@ekomaintenance.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
